comment.body:
https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/issues/140217#issuecomment-1386702231 - It has been fixed yesterday, but the problem is that ad blockers based on Manifest V3 cannot update filters (it's necessary to update the whole extension), so it will probably be fixed in the next version of the extension.

Please add these rules:
```adblock
@@||crackle.com/vendor/adex.js
crackle.com#%#//scriptlet('json-prune', 'data.device.adsParams')
```
to the user rules.

The patch will be available in up to 4 hours.
After that time, you can download it by clicking `Check for filter updates...` in AdGuard tray menu.

<details>

패치는 최대 4시간안에 사용하실 수 있습니다.
최대 4시간이 지난 후에 AdGuard 트레이 메뉴에 있는 `필터 업데이트 확인...`을 클릭하여 다운로드하실 수 있습니다.

</details>

comment.body:
Не повторяется. Включите фильтр раздражителей, но основное решение в AdGuard Extra. Также нужно будет очистить данные браузера.

---

This issue is known to be solved with [AdGuard Extra](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdGuardExtra) userscript.

If you’re using AdGuard Browser Extension, we suggest installing AdGuard Extra in addition to it.

* [Install for Chrome, Edge or other Chromium-based browsers](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_chrome_release)
* [Install for Firefox](https://agrd.io/adguard_extra_firefox_release)

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Incorrect Blocking) [https://trello.com/b/UxSwOSpw/rezepte](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Ftrello.com%2Fb%2FUxSwOSpw%2Frezepte) ### Comment Username: @Scolaro > Screenshot 1 (AdGuard on): I press "Attachment", choose the image I want to upload to the card and get the error message in the lower left corner. > Screenshot 2 (AdGuard off): I press "Attachment", choose the image I want to upload to the card and get the success message. The image appears in the card. > > Every once in a while an image goes through when AdGuard is on (because I forget to turn it off), but it's mostly the first one, then nothing else goes through until I turn AdGuard off. > Oftentimes I also get an error (from Trello on their website) that I am not connected to the server. Everything (creating cards, changing text etc) continues to work except for the image upload, and once AdGuard is off there are no more server error messages on the Trello site either. > Note that all my Trello pages are affected by this issue, not just the "Rezepte" one from the screenshots. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/27u9kQt.jpg)
Screenshot 2 ![Screenshot 2](https://reports-img.adguard.com/9IRBpWq.jpg)

comment.body:
I can reproduce it, if I disable `AdGuard Annoyances filter`.
Maybe we should move the generic rule (`#$#div[class*="ad" i][style="width: 1px; height: 1px; position: absolute; left: -10000px; top: -10000px; z-index: -10000;"] { display: block !important; }`) to Base filter, or not yet?

I will add rules to fix cookie notice.

comment.body:
Not reproduced it on my end with different IPs.
Try to clear browser data, update the filters (wait almost one minute there), open the site.
If that doesn't work, you should re-enable the content blockers in Safari settings (wait about the same time as when you update the filters).

Everything (creating cards, changing text etc) continues to work except for the image upload, and once AdGuard is off there are no more server error messages on the Trello site either. > Note that all my Trello pages are affected by this issue, not just the "Rezepte" one from the screenshots. ### Screenshots

comment.body: This behavior is intermittent.  I don’t think they show the “Continue Reading in the App” prompt on every page.  It also only shows once you scroll down if it is going to show.  I know that makes it hard to reproduce.  I suspect (but don’t know) that you may need to be logged in to the nytimes to get this behavior.   The reason I think that is true is because I have a relative with the exact same iPad running Adguard exactly the same (I set it up) but she does not have an account on nytimes and is not logged in and she does not get the prompt.

issue.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.nytimes.com/2023/01/13/business/bed-bath-beyond-bankruptcy-assets.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.nytimes.com%2F2023%2F01%2F13%2Fbusiness%2Fbed-bath-beyond-bankruptcy-assets.html) ### Comment Username: @Adguard-fixme > Continue Reading in the App popup at bottom of screen. This occurs on various pages on the site. It also greys out and disables the background. If I turn on the AdGuard Mobile App Banners filter it hides the element but the screen still greys out and disables input. I am logged in to the site so that may contribute to the problem—though I don’t know that for sure. ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/Gkc0yLx.png)

comment.body:
- If you enable DNS filtering in the AdGuard app for android, you can add `@@||api.amplitude.com^` to the custom dns filter.
`DNS filtering -> Block DNS requests -> Custom DNS filter`
- If you want to use the [adguard-dns.io](adguard-dns.io) service, you have to register and add the device in the server settings. Instructions on how to connect the device are in` server settings -> connect new device
`After adding the device add an unblocking rule in `User rules`

I looked up how to debug a web page on my iPad with my Mac and grabbed a copy of a .js file that has the "Continue Reading in the App" string from a webpage on the nytimes that exhibited the behavior.  I'm not a web developer though and know nothing about adguard rule syntax so hopefully you can solve this now for me :)

Let me know if you need anything else.  I am happy to test anything also.

comment.body:
### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://jastrzabpost.pl/newsy/pytanie-na-sniadanie-prowadzacy-musieli-przerwac-program_1287164.html](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fjastrzabpost.pl%2Fnewsy%2Fpytanie-na-sniadanie-prowadzacy-musieli-przerwac-program_1287164.html) ### Comment > Kolejny problem jaki wykryłem. Jeżeli ktoś wchodzi tylko na jastrzabpost a nie wchodzi na inne domeny WP, to pokaże się komunikat. Znika dopiero wtedy gdy wejdziemy na jakąś inną domenę WP, gdzie ten komunikat chyba zatwierdzi reguła zbiorcza i odświeżymy. Wyczyść u siebie wszystkie cookies z WP i ich domen i od razu wejdź na jastrząb a zobaczysz o co chodzi. W przyszłości musicie takie okoliczności sprawdzać, bo jak widać jest nierozpoznany, może mało istotny ale problem. > Mam też nadzieje a tego nie wiem, że przy zatwierdzaniu cookies przez regułę, gdy w komunikacie jest wybór zgody czy niezgody na przetwarzanie i zbieranie danych, to zawsze powinno być najpierw auto klikane wszystkie przyciski sprzeciwów na wszystko i dopiero przycisk Zapisz. Jeżeli jeszcze tak nie ma, to czym prędzej pracujcie na tym, bo to bardzo istotne. Pozdro ### Screenshots
Screenshot 1 ![Screenshot 1](https://reports-img.adguard.com/vweQXRB.png)
